resources.string: Before I started my final year project in college the only thing I knew about Android was that its icon was green. I started the development of a native application for mobile devices for an existing project about online stores to get into the mobile development environment.

The idea seemed easy at first but the full project took me almost a year, including an exhaustive and deep documentation of it that allowed me to know the platform in detail. The grade I obtained, first class with distinction, was a huge joy for me and a fair reward.

Thanks to all the effort, I started working in Kernet, where I kept on expanding my knowledge and using all I had learnt. A lot of refactoring, code reusing and debugging, with great supervision made me able to be in charge of projects on my own in less than three months.

Despite not having developed apps for clients in more than one year, I try to keep myself up to date with the news and latest features of Android. I think it will be the main mobile OS for a while, although I\'m eager to learn about other platforms.

I\'ve been interested in web development since the first time I accessed the internet. I created my first website in the year 2000, I started learning on my own about the coolest web solutions at that time such as frames or flash. The first CMS that were coming, like PHPNuke seemed really useful at that time and boosted my PHP knowledge.

When I started college I focused on client-server applications. It wasn\'t until the last years of my degree that i got access to lectures and courses on new frameworks and different programming languages like Struts, Symfony or Ruby on Rails.

I think web development is one of my key points. Although I haven\'t worked in many professional projects, I know most of the tools used and the trends of the industry and I\'m really good at adapting to new environments and languages.

Although I don\'t have any official exams or qualifications I have an almost bilingual level of English. All the documentation I use is in English and if I have to google something I obviously do it in this language.

Living in Canada for more than one year has been a great experience in this matter. I\'ve learnt a less academic language through daily use, but also I had the chance to express myself in a more professional and technical level thanks to being in charge of the IT department of the office.
Issued in 2008 by the Federación Española de Salvamento.
I worked in Asturias beaches in the summers of 2008, 2009 and 2010.
Issued in 2011 by the Escuela del Deporte del Principado de Asturias.
I worked as a ski instructor in San Isidro in 2011 for Paraven SA.
Android SDK, Java, ORMLite, C#, .NET Compact Framework, XML
J2EE, XHTML, PHP, JQuery, Struts, Symfony, Hibernate, Spring, Wordpress, XAMPP
Windows XP - 8, Win 2003 Server, UNIX, Linux
It has always been my biggest passion. I love the snow and gliding over it with pretty much anything under my feet.

Since I got my first camera, I\'ve always tried to make the recordings something else than a memory forgotten in an old tape. Combining video recording, editing and skiing enhances the experiences even further.
Check out Eduardo Martinez CV App.
You can download the app here https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.edusofter.educv
I have seen your application and I would like to contact you.
This application has been developed for the main purpose of showing and practicing some of my Android development Skills.
I have tried to follow the Android design guidelines for the application, keeping it as Holo as possible.
You can send your questions, ideas or suggestions to
I\'m Winston Wolf. I solve problems.
You didn\'t say the magic word
What is the air-speed velocity of an unladen swallow?
What do you mean? An African or European swallow?
I wasn\'t expecting the spanish inquisition.
Ni! Ni! Ni ni ni ni!
The answer to the ultimate question of life, the universe, and everything is…

string-array.name: monkeyEnding
string-array.item: Ok, that\'s it, turn off your computer and do something constructive.
Or travel to a foreign country.
Or talk to a member of the opposite sex.
Or have a yelling contest with your neighbour\'s dog.
Or paint a yellow line in the center of your driveway.
Or write your name in the snow.
Or teach basket weaving to clams.
Or sing Welsh folk songs at the bank.
Or plant trees on public property.
Or confuse the person next to you.
Or organize your sock drawer alphabetically.
Or go bowling with your mom.
Or train potato bugs to do tricks.
Or publish a magazine about pencil shavings.
Or eat lime jello with pineapple in it.
Or paint a stranger\'s house in the middle of the night.
Or play croquet with your dad.
Or invite some friends over for salmon and white wine.
Or get nostalgic and write me an email.

string-array.name: monkeyTesting
string-array.item: Ok, that\'s it, turn off your computer and do something constructive.
Or get nostalgic and write me an email.

resources.string: I just watched the whole Monkey Island II ending, and it was awesome.
